title.narrative: Agriculture and Livestock intervention for affected population of Balochistan Earthquake

description.narrative: Outputs • 10,000 animals (2,000 large animals and 8,000 small animals) belonging to 1000 HH enabled to survived through winter through provision of animal feed, antibiotics and dewormers. 50 000 small ruminants or 5 000 large ruminants be placed in 100 newly built animal shelters. • In total, 100 MT of animal compound feed 300 doses of antibiotics and 575 lt dewormers for 30 000 animals will be distributed. 100 animal shelters built. • Extension materials prepared and technical assistance provided to all partners to ensure effective targeting of beneficiaries, best practices in livestock management and efficient use of inputs provided to beneficiaries.

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Agriculture and Livestock intervention for affected population of Balochistan Earthquake

receiver-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
